meanings.definition: To make (something) seem environmentally friendly or sustainable, especially in a misleading way.
meanings.sent1: The company tried to greenwash their image by planting a few trees.
meanings.sent2: Some businesses greenwash their products to attract eco-conscious consumers.
meanings.sent3: The attempt to greenwash the toxic waste dump with a small garden was laughable.
meanings.sent4: His promises to greenwash the polluted river fell flat when the truth was revealed.
meanings.sent5: The politician's attempt to greenwash his record was quickly exposed by investigative journalists.

meanings.definition: The act of making (something) seem environmentally friendly or sustainable, especially in a misleading way.
meanings.sent1: Greenwash is a common tactic used by companies to appear eco-friendly.
meanings.sent2: Consumers are becoming more aware of greenwash in advertising.
meanings.sent3: The city's greenwash of the new landfill as a 'nature reserve' was met with skepticism.
meanings.sent4: The company's greenwash of their harmful practices was like putting lipstick on a pig.
meanings.sent5: The documentary exposed the industry's greenwash for what it really was - deception.
